page.title: 03 NAISH FARM
page.content:
Naish Farm was once a farm owned by Mr. Burry. In 1902 people started asking the owner if they could bring {caravans}for holidays. When the owner died he left the farm in his will to his son who built it into a holiday resort. To rent a{chalet}for a week it costs Â£94.00.The amusements at Naish Farm are {tennis, swimming}and an {arcade.}Altogether there are{1500 {units}(chalets and caravans). There are two rooms in each chalet. There is also a{bar}called the "Smugglers' Retreat". Also there are two{shops,}a {newsagent}and a{supermarket.}Sometimes there is also a little{adventure {playground}for children but it is not always open.
By Robin Taylor and Paul Hayes.
